concepts.title: Simple Sentence
concepts.definition: A sentence with one independent clause expressing a complete thought.

concepts.title: Compound Sentence
concepts.definition: A sentence that has two or more independent clauses joined by a coordinating conjunction.
concepts.example: She plays the piano, and he sings along.

concepts.title: Complex Sentence
concepts.definition: A sentence that contains one independent clause and at least one dependent clause.
concepts.example: She plays the piano because she loves music.

concepts.title: Compound-Complex Sentence
concepts.definition: A sentence containing two or more independent clauses and one or more dependent clauses.
concepts.example: She plays the piano because she loves music, and he listens quietly.

concepts.title: Clause
concepts.definition: A group of words containing a subject and a predicate.
